description:
NetDocuments is enterprise content management in the cloud. Small to large organizations, including many of the Am Law 100 firms, rely on NetDocuments‚Äô modern, secure solution for intelligent and confidential document and email management. With decades of document management experience, NetDocuments continually enhances the application, providing customer firms the most innovative solution for document and email management available in the market today. By eliminating on-premises or hosted system hardware and moving into the security of the cloud, the IT burden is dramatically decreased, reducing the cost and complexity of the DMS.

No other cloud-based document management solution is more secure than NetDocuments. Data security and strict digital asset protection are key differentiators of the service that allow law firms and other industries with strict compliance and security guidelines to confidently store and collaborate on their documents and email. Additionally, our powerful integrations with Microsoft Office allow for smart editing, drafting, searching, and version control. Extranets, secure links, and client portals provide collaboration and security to outside parties who need real time access to their documents.

The pillars of our service include mobility, secure collaboration, disaster recovery, and compliance, and our SaaS (subscription-as-a-service) model requires us to proactively engage with our customers, ensuring we are meeting stringent requirements on a day-to-day basis. This includes managing a robust network for technical support and communities to share knowledge and insight regarding best practices.

document and email management for law firms of all sizes
client portals for external sharing and collaboration

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
Webinar replay: Driving the platform evolution ‚Äì Transforming legal work with Generative AI

In this webinar we looked at some newly released NetDocuments‚Äô tools, including AI Profiling and its new Agentic AI Editing Tool, exploring what good metadata means for lawyer efficiency.

Legal IT Insider‚Äôs editor Caroline Hill was joined by Jennifer Poon, who currently serves as legal AI solutions director at NetDocuments. Poon has nearly a decade of legal experience and was previously litigation counsel at Akin Gump and before that was a corporate associate at Simpson Thacher.
We talked about how important good metadata is for search ‚Äì that hasn‚Äôt changed in a generative AI world ‚Äì and how having data semantically indexed can trigger further workflows.

Poon gave a demo of the AI profiling tool, which enables firms to apply a consistent taxonomy across their document set. With the editing tool, you can then apply global edits at scale.

We discussed best practices and challenges around creating a taxonomy, and the types of workflows that can be triggered when all the relevant profile attributes are filled out, for example triggering a review process for a lease agreement after a period of time.

We also chatted with listeners on a range of topics, including how to manage a situation where some clients don‚Äôt allow their firm to use generative AI.

To listen to the webinar click¬†HERE üîó https://lnkd.in/gsRVYWGg

#legaltech #AI #GenerativeAI #NetDocuments #webinar

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
What does it take to stay competitive in Japan‚Äôs legal market?

Last month in Tokyo, we hosted an executive briefing with senior leaders from 8 of Japan‚Äôs top 10 law firms, alongside experts from NetDocuments (Dan Hauck), Amazon Web Services (AWS) (Yusuke Kondo), Elite Technology (James Bible), and our very own director Risto Jaagant. 

What stood out wasn't necessary the appetite for AI or automation per se, it was the realisation that competitive advantage isn't about who adopts tech first, but who integrates it best. 

The consistent theme is that firms are thinking carefully how tech fits their business model, their client relationships, and their competitive position. 

The conversation moved quickly from features to fundamentals:
‚ú® How knowledge is structured and accessed across the firm
‚ú® Where real risk sits in client delivery
‚ú® How profitability is being redefined through operational design

Thank you to those who joined us for an open and forward-looking discussion. 

Robert Aitken | Verlata Consulting
